titles: A most pleasant and merie nevv comedie, intituled, A knacke to knowe a knaue Newlie set foorth, as it hath sundrie tymes bene played by Ed. Allen and his companie. VVith Kemps applauded merrimentes of the men of Goteham, in receiuing the King into Goteham.
author: Kemp, William, fl. 1600.
publisher: By [i.e. for] Richard Iones, dwelling at the signe of the Rose and Crowne, nere Holborne bridge,
notes: Jones' role as publisher from STC.
Running title reads: A merie knacke to knowe a knaue.
